criteria: Understanding Fractions as Sums of Unit Fractions
Solving Word Problems with Addition and Subtraction of Fractions
Using Visual Fraction Models and Equations
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of fractions as sums of unit fractions.
Student can identify some fractions as sums of unit fractions with significant errors.
Student can represent simple fractions as sums of unit fractions with minor errors.
Student accurately represents fractions as sums of unit fractions.
Student accurately represents fractions as sums of unit fractions and explains the concept clearly.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of fractions as sums of unit fractions, explaining the concept and providing multiple representations.
Student cannot solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions.

Student can solve simple word problems with fractions but makes frequent errors in calculations or setup.
Student accurately solves most word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators.
Student consistently solves word problems accurately and demonstrates clear steps in their solutions.
Student solves complex word problems involving fractions, clearly explains their reasoning, and demonstrates a strong understanding of the underlying concepts.

Student attempts to use visual fraction models and equations but struggles with accuracy and representation.
Student uses visual fraction models and equations with some inaccuracies.
Student accurately uses visual fraction models and equations to represent and solve fraction problems.
Student effectively uses visual fraction models and equations to clearly communicate solutions.
Student creatively and effectively uses visual fraction models and equations to represent and solve complex fraction problems, providing insightful explanations.
